story_teamaquamagma_02_01000/2401_1101_0:
A short time before Courtney and Groudon—as
well as Matt and Kyogre—lost control...
story_teamaquamagma_02_01000/2401_1001_0:
Natural energy is building deep in the ocean floor
around Pasio.

That may be one of the reasons why a lot of sync
stones get dug up near there.

As I expected, that energy is what caused our
current situation.

Steven, do you mind sharing your thoughts
with us?
Sure! This is just a theory of mine, but...

Because the meteor that Zinnia saw fell
near Pasio...

I think the natural energy beneath the seabed
erupted and excited Groudon and Kyogre.
story_teamaquamagma_02_01000/2401_1001_1:
I even have some evidence that backs up
this theory.

Back when I was researching the Draconid people,
I read something...

It was in “The Thousand-Year-Old Lore of
Super-Ancient Pokémon,” and it recounted an
event similar to ours.

Also, Zinnia believes there may be someone who’s
trying to use this commotion for an evil purpose...

Oh, it’s nothing, really... But the talk about meteors
is reminding me of something.

I know someone who’s been researching
astronomy, and according to them...

there may be a possibility of a huge meteor
impacting this planet in the near future.

It’s only a possibility, so the chances of a
catastrophic event are still low, but...
story_teamaquamagma_02_01000/2401_1001_2:
I heard that the meteor Zinnia saw was supposed
to fall in the ocean quite a distance from Pasio.

But the fact that the meteor fell in the ocean so
close to Pasio has been bothering me...
So you’re thinking this might be a bad omen.

It could be that similar things happened very close
to each other, but...

Just in case, I will ask my contact more
about meteors.

I’m going to investigate whether someone caused
this commotion intentionally.
